name: uk-home-office-nonpersonaldata
notes:
### About

From website:

> On this page we will link to non-personal data sets as they are published across the Home Office.

> This is the first step to meeting one of the key recommendations in the Power of Information Taskforce Report (new window).

> The government should ensure that public information data sets are easy to find and use. The government should create a place or places online where public information can be stored and maintained (a 'repository') or its location and characteristics listed (an online catalogue)â€™ - Recommendation 14.

> If you write about or comment on these data sets, please include the hash-tag #honpdata. This will help us gather your thoughts and suggestions, and make use of these in developing this resource, which we hope will become a valuable source of public information.

### Openness

[Terms](page) says material is available under the [PSI Click Use license](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/terms):

> The material featured on this website is subject to Crown copyright protection unless otherwise indicated. You may re-use the Crown copyright protected material (not including the Royal Arms and other departmental or agency logos) free of charge in any format for non-commercial research, private study or internal circulation within your organisation. The material must be acknowledged as Crown copyright and you must give the title of the source document/publication.

> For any other proposed use of the material please apply for a Click-Use Licence for core material from the Office of Public Sector Information [...]
title: Home Office - Non-personal data
